column4: Does mixing applications from multiple Ubuntu variations (kubuntu, xubuntu, etc) hurt system performance significantly?

it definitely can. if you have GNOME, for instance, loading a KDE application means loading all the various KDE libraries. as long as you're not out of RAM, though, it's unlikely that performance (aside from application startup time) will be very significantly affected. Xfce, on the other hand, uses GTK like GNOME, so they should play well together
